meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone as a greeting or to get their attention.
meanings.sent1: The children were halloaing to their friends across the playground.
meanings.sent2: She halloaed to her neighbor from her front porch.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started halloaing back at the kids, mimicking their calls.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the halloaing voices echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: He was halloaing so loudly that even the birds stopped chirping.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting or calling out loudly to someone as a greeting or to get their attention.
meanings.sent1: The halloaing from the crowd could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: His halloaing was so loud that it startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The halloaing of the fans at the concert added to the excitement.
meanings.sent4: The halloaing of the vendors filled the busy marketplace.
meanings.sent5: The constant halloaing in the street made it hard to concentrate.
